DOC.brief_summary: This study multicenter post authorization observational study . Cancer patient diagnose non high risk VTE follow outpatient setting treat LMWH data record . Since observational study specific treatment protocol , i.e. , patient treat accord best investigator 's criterion . Treatment protocol base routine treatment practice involve investigator . Patients enroll cancer patient diagnose VTE able receive outpatient LMWH treatment . There specific hypothesis test .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness And Safety LMWH Treatment Cancer Patients Diagnosed With Non-High Risk Venous Thromboembolism
DOC.detailed_description: Inclusion criterion - 18 year upper age - A sign informed consent document - Cancer patient diagnose VTE - Life expectancy > 6 month - Eligible criterion outpatient administration LMWH Exclusion criterion • Should carry medical situation list , outpatient administration LMWH might risky : 1 . Patients active bleed at-risk bleeding 2 . Major surgery last 7 day 3 . Cardiopulmonary unstability 4 . Severe systemic venous occlusion 5 . Patients high risk pulmonary embolism 6 . Thrombocytopenia ( < 50000/microliter ) 7 . Inpatients medical surgery supervision 8 . Patients low ability communicate possible provide care home 9 . INR≥1.5 due liver function impairment 10 . Diagnosed cerebral vascular aneurism 11 . Active gastric and/or duodenum ulcer 12 . Diagnosed bacterial endocarditis 13 . Severe renal function impairment ( Creatinine clearance < 30 ml/min ) 14 . Grade 3 hypertension ( DBP > = 110 mmHg and/or SBP > = 180 mmHg ) 15 . < 35 kg ≥110 kg weight 16 . Known allergy heparin and/or derivatives 17 . History cerebrovascular event last 1 month 18 . Active haemorrhage within last 3 month
DOC.criteria: 18 year upper age A sign informed consent document Cancer patient diagnose VTE Life expectancy > 6 month Eligible criterion outpatient administration LMWH Patients active bleeding atrisk bleed Major surgery last 7 day Cardiopulmonary unstability Severe systemic venous occlusion Patients high risk pulmonary embolism Thrombocytopenia ( < 50000/microliter ) Inpatients medical surgery supervision Patients low ability communicate possible provide care home INR≥1.5 due liver function impairment Diagnosed cerebral vascular aneurism Active gastric and/or duodenum ulcer Diagnosed bacterial endocarditis Severe renal function impairment ( Creatinine clearance < 30 ml/min ) Grade 3 hypertension ( DBP > = 110 mmHg and/or SBP > = 180 mmHg ) < 35 kg ≥110 kg weight Known allergy heparin and/or derivative History cerebrovascular event last 1 month Active haemorrhage within last 3 month
